isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - TURBOCHARGERS - REMOVAL AND INSPECTION - Visual Inspection

step1.para: Visually inspect the compressor impeller and turbine wheel for blade erosion, bending, breakage or deposits. Replace as required.

note.para: Compressor impeller and turbine wheel deposits can be caused by the following:

step1.para: HIGH AIR INLET RESTRICTION - which allows oil to transfer from the turbocharger center housing, resulting in oil deposits.
EXCESSIVE OIL CONSUMPTION - resulting in turbine wheel carbon deposits.
ENGINE OVERFUELING - can result in excessive operating temperatures which can cause aluminum components to melt. Such deposits may be found on the turbine wheel if such a failure occurs.
Visually inspect the turbine and compressor housings for evidence of wheel rubbing. Replace the housing(s) as required.

important.para: DO NOT ATTEMPT TO STRAIGHTEN BENT WHEEL BLADES.

step1.para: If the turbocharger passes all pre-disassembly inspections, reinstall on engine. (See installation, this section.) If one or more inspections are out of specification or visually unacceptable, follow the instructions in this section under "REASSEMBLY".
